page.title: 12Heathcote Memorial School.
page.content: Heathcote Memorial C of E Middle School was built in 1860 by the Church of England in union with the National Society. It is named after the Rev. Gilbert Wall Heathcote who was Rector of Ash l838-1884. Ash National School (now demolished) was built in l835 and had become too small for the numbers of children attending. Heathcote School became known as Ash Common School due to its location and is still referred to in this way by many people in the village. It has always been looked on as the village school and some pupils now are the 4th or 5th generation of their family to have been educated here. The century and a quarter has been marked by an exhibition of photographs and children's work and a musical and dramatic production of the school's history performed by the pupils.
